title: Part G
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not provide both the correct choice and a valid justification equivalent to the following.

· Less than. Since both elements are in the same row of the periodic table, their valence electrons occupy the same shell. However, since L has a substantially greater atomic mass than E, then L must also have a higher atomic number and therefore a greater number of protons in its nucleus. The valence electrons in L thus experience a greater effective nuclear charge compared to E and are, on average, closer to the nucleus because they are more strongly attracted.

The response provides both the correct choice and a valid justification equivalent to the following.

· Less than. Since both elements are in the same row of the periodic table, their valence electrons occupy the same shell. However, since L has a substantially greater atomic mass than E, then L must also have a higher atomic number and therefore a greater number of protons in its nucleus. The valence electrons in L thus experience a greater effective nuclear charge compared to E and are, on average, closer to the nucleus because they are more strongly attracted.
